  • 2005-03-24 01:17:57

    Solved! but have the new question....

    Dear Greg,

    Sorry! I did not inform you, as I have found what is the actual reason and solved it yesterday.

    [red] The reason and HowTo Solve:[/red]
    The actual Reason is: when I config a new course, I define the course property ==> Primary Languange ==> Traditional Chinese.
    But the course you defined in your site is English. Therefore, when I import the IMS/SCORM .zip file into my Atutuor site, no wonder that when I entered the course (by my another testing account) it alsways show in English (even I have defined it as Traditional Chinese).
    Thus, it caused EXPORT-ERROR problem until I re-define the Primary Language as English.

    [Green]The New Question[/Green]
    If I use Atutor in my company and there are our several sites in diferent countries by local languange. It might cause the problems while we ask the local stuffs to translate the content into local Language.[red]How could we solve this new problem?[/red]

    Looking forward to hearing from you soon. Should you have any further question, please do not hesitate to contact me at any time.

    Best regards,
    Augustus Hsieh

  • 2005-03-24 09:12:14

    Translating to UTF-8

    I'm not sure I understand what you are asking.

    Coverting languages you are using into UTF-8 would be the best choice for cross language compatibility. Though there would be some effort involve on your part, fixing the language that breaks when the character set is changed.

    I suggest you experiment and see if there are problems with importing content of one language into a system displayed in another language, and document what happens.

    See the language section of the current ATutor HowTo course for further details.

    http://www.atutor.ca/atutor/docs/howto.php

    [reply][b]In reply to:[/b]

  • 2005-03-26 13:07:20

    Create a backup and move the course

    -Create a backup of the course you are referring to
    -Download the backup
    -Create a new course (on the same site)
    -Upload the backup to the new course
    -Restore the backup into the new course


    Then use the Export tool to create an IMS content package.

  • 2005-03-29 15:07:33

    Adjust characters in language database field

    Try changing the language_code field in the languages database of ATutor from 4 characters to 5 characters. Use an application like phpMyAdmin to do this easily. Since Chinese uses a language extension (e.g. zh-tw) that make the code five characters long, the code breaks when inserted into a field that only allows 4 characters.

    Let us know if that helps.


  • 2005-03-29 20:07:32
